column4: Quick simple question guys. I'm installing Ubuntu. At the last step when it asks about installing a boot loader, if I tell it to install the boot loader to the Ubuntu partition, that means as long as that partition is active, it'll boot, right? Meaning I don't have to install it to the master boot record, right?
are you using any other operating systems?
If you install to the MBR, and Windows is/was previously installed, the MBR will boot over your Ubuntu partition.
And btw, when you install Vista, it'll overwrite whatever's on your MBR.
I don't think so. If there's anything on the MBR it'll boot the MBR first.
That's weird. XP/Vista's boot loader won't load Ubuntu.
